title: reverence
comment: The proper sense of awe, respect and wonder that is inspired and demanded by an encounter with, or meditation upon, the character and activity of the living God.

children.title: reverence, and God's nature
children.comment: Reverence for God results from considering his nature and all that he has done.

children.title: Believers should revere God and meditate upon his deeds
Reverence is to be reserved exclusively for God
Reverence for God's creative activity
Reverence for God's eternal existence
Reverence for God's name
Reverence for God's holiness
Reverence for God's word
Reverence for God's works
Reverence for God's mercy and compassion
Reverence for God's intervention in healing
Reverence for God's judgment
Reverence for God's anger
Gentile nations will also revere and fear God
Reverent fear of God is not mere terror but includes trust

seealsos.comment: Jacob feels reverent awe in the presence of the God who has just promised to bless him

children.title: Reverent fear of God is a remedy against other fears
reverence, and blessing
children.comment: Reverence for God brings favour to individual believers, their families and the community to which they belong.

children.title: God's blessing is conditional upon reverence for him
The characteristics of reverence
Wisdom is based on reverence for God
Reverence is pure and eternal
Reverence will characterise the Messiah
God responds to those who revere him
Reverence brings God's special attention and compassion
God is good to those who revere him
Reverence brings God's protection and deliverance
God meets the needs of those who revere him
Reverence for God is rewarded
God rewards the reverent with prosperity
Those who revere God avoid his judgment
God rewards reverence with long life and future hope
God's blessings on those who revere him are a witness to the nations
Reverence ensures success in leadership
reverence, and obedience
children.comment: Reverence towards God expresses itself in the actions, as well as the words and worship of believers. True reverence for God leads to obedience towards him.

children.title: Reverent fear is expressed in worship
Reverence in worship is expressed in bodily attitudes
Reverence can be learnt through religious observances
A shared meal in God's presence
Hearing God's word
Reading God's word
Reverence motivates people to avoid doing wrong
Reverence leads people to obey God's law
Reverence is characterised by fearing God
Gentile believers were called ``God-fearing''
reverence, and social behaviour
children.comment: Reverence for God leads to proper respect for others and right relationships among the people of God.

children.title: Reverence for God affects believers' attitudes
Reverence produces respect for others
Reverence affects social attitudes
Attitudes to work are affected by reverence to God
Reverence for God affects believers' behaviour

secondaryrefs.comment: Reverence for God should be respected
Reverence for God inspires a slave's respect for his master.

children.title: Reverence for God may reduce hostility
Lack of reverence has an adverse effect on behaviour
Reverence can be shown to fellow human beings as God's representatives
